title: Decolonizing Digital Learning Spaces: Reconstructing Social Perspectives Through Reflective Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: For in-service elementary teachers with digital instructional material development experience, conducting Zoom-based collaborative activities in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Learners develop a critical framework to analyze cultural biases in digital learning environments.
Learners recognize and articulate their educational positionality (positionality) through the process of writing reflective essays.
Learners produce at least one draft of a digital learning activity design incorporating a decolonial perspective.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
